programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: MMA fighter Urijah Faber just opened his new gym and wants a bit of the ocean inside. And a couple wants a tank for the Marine Aquarium Convention.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: The clinic takes in displaced animals when Houston is devastated by heavy rains and fatal flooding. Dr Blue treats a puppy with a deadly disease.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr. Ross treats baby kangaroos and meets the owners of a petting zoo to plan an event at the clinic. And Dr. Lavigne treats a vision and hearing-impaired Great Dane.

programme.title: The Last Alaskans
programme.desc: As winter tightens its grip, the days shorten - with less daylight for checking traps. Heimo and Ednas fur count is down, and wolves invade their traplines.

programme.title: Im Alive
programme.desc: A mother bitten on each hand by a deadly cottonmouth snake, and a teenage tourist gored by an elephant in Kenya share their extraordinary tales of survival.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson faces the vicious claws of a troubled cat whos terrorizing a family about to bring home a newborn baby. Plus, he meets an inspirational cat named Skinny.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: While Bindi and the keepers ready Sophie the baby Giraffe for her first steps into her enclosure, Robert helps to raise another baby: Melman the Kangaroo.

programme.title: Dr. Dee: Alaska Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Dee checks a high-kicking pack horse, and Dr. Terry and Nicole head to Arctic Village for a remote clinic. Dr. Dee treats a dog with a cancerous-looking mass.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Fisherman and adventurer, Jeremy Wade, travels to western Australia to discover what is wiping out many of the fish in Australias Fitzroy River. What will he find?

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff fights to save a pit bull bitten by a rattlesnake; the team battles to save a cherished cat rescued from an apartment fire.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: A previous customer is back, asking for an even bigger and better tank. And, the guys build a custom acrylic waterfall for a memorial in Las Vegas.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr. Ross and vet tech Kyrra rust to save the life of a stray cat injured by a car engine. And, Dr. Blue treats a 700lb pig who suffers from arthritis.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr Ross takes care of a pair of roosters involved in a barnyard brawl and joins Dr Lavigne for a hyena consultation. And, Dr Blue treats a paralysed Yorkie.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: A beloved basset hound has a condition that could complicate surgery for Dr. Ross. Plus, Dr. Lavigne doesnt want a vet tech to assist in an operation on her own dog.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: In Chambers County, Dockery responds to a call about an alligator stuck in a residential area. Plus, the Wardens find blood in the boot of a suspicious hunters car.

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun battles high winds to get a loveable cat named Tigger, a repeat offender, back down to his family once again. Plus, Tom comes to the rescue of Fritter.

programme.title: Treetop Cat Rescue
programme.desc: Shaun learns the hard way that "Cake" isnt as sweet as his name implies when he tries to reunite this skittish cat with its owners.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: As VRC braces for Hurricane Barry, Tia and her crew ensure the animals safety and Mariah and Earl tend to a stray Labradoodle that has been shot. Later, a cancer survivor hopes to rescue an unwanted dog she loves called East.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: A soft-spoken musician who feels abused by her cat and ashamed that she can’t figure out how to stop it; A family afraid to furnish their house because the cat they rescued from Katrina stricken New Orleans, is spraying the house and dividing the family.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: While Bindi and the keepers ready Sophie the baby Giraffe for her first steps into her enclosure, Robert helps to raise another baby: Melman the Kangaroo.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff fights to save a pit bull bitten by a rattlesnake; the team battles to save a cherished cat rescued from an apartment fire.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Seven foot tall NBA Star Hassan Whiteside knows a thing or two about what it means to be BIG. He tasks Wayde and Brett with building him a tank SO BIG it wont fit through the front door and has to be delivered to his Miami pad on a barge!

programme.title: Jungle Shark
programme.desc: Dr. Craig OConnell and Andy Casagrande travel up the Serena River to try and find out why young bull sharks swim up the river, and how they avoid the crocodiles living there.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: When winter claims its first casualty, Jim transports the casket. Plus, Luke feels the pressure when he has to fly dangerous chemicals to an isolated village.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: A beloved basset hound has a condition that could complicate surgery for Dr. Ross. Plus, Dr. Lavigne doesnt want a vet tech to assist in an operation on her own dog.

programme.title: In Search Of Monsters
programme.desc: Experts analyse new evidence that could prove the legendary bloodsucking beast known as Chupacabra is real, and that there are two versions of the creature!

programme.title: Fish Or Die
programme.desc: Off the eastern tip of Papua New Guinea lies Milne Bay: the rumoured home to huge schools of the giant trevally. The crew try to hook one on a fly rod.

programme.title: Im Alive
programme.desc: When a humpback whale rams a sailboat, the crew are forced to abandon ship in the middle of the ocean. Their chances of survival are slim. Will they all make it?

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: A previous customer is back, asking for an even bigger and better tank. And, the guys build a custom acrylic waterfall for a memorial in Las Vegas.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: A health scare scuppers Dr. Blues dreams of motorcycle riding with his brother. Meanwhile, Dr. Ross treats a sweet bearded dragon who is laying bad eggs.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr. Ross and Tauvia decide to move out of his mums house. Meanwhile, Dr. Blue sees a pig thats feeling amorous for household furniture.

programme.title: Jungle Shark
programme.desc: Dr. Craig OConnell and Andy Casagrande travel up the Serena River to try and find out why young bull sharks swim up the river, and how they avoid the crocodiles living there.

programme.title: Im Alive
programme.desc: When a humpback whale rams a sailboat, the crew are forced to abandon ship in the middle of the ocean. Their chances of survival are slim. Will they all make it?

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: An old friend enlists Jacksons help to recruit a new generation of volunteers in an effort to save community cats in Philadelphia.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri welcomes Mballa, a new cheetah cub from South Africa, to the Australia Zoo family. Meanwhile, Robert sets out to save a stranded platypus.

programme.title: Dr. Dee: Alaska Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Dee flies her mom to a remote vet clinic in Manley Hot Springs, Alaska. At Animal House, a bunny has a tricky abscess, and some St. Bernard puppies visit the clinic!

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Tales of monstrous pike have persisted in Europe for generations. Jeremy Wade is on a journey to catch this prehistoric monster, starting in the lakes of Ireland and leading to waters on the edge of the Arctic Circle in Sweden.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff helps Lola who needs major surgery on her kidneys and Dr Amy meets Bobo who’s badly wounded after a cat fight. Animal control brings in a neglected dog, Juicy.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: A successful American football player, Clay Matthews, is in the process of building his dream home and wants a dream aquarium to match.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr Blue needs to act fast when a Rottweiler in labor is rushed to the hospital. And, the three vets put on their cowboy boots for Houstons biggest rodeo parade.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: The docs visit their alma mater for a class reunion and become professors for a day. Meanwhile, a pit bull with a deformed leg needs drastic surgery.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Yuki the bulldog ate something she shouldnt have, now Dr. Blue needs to find it. And, the rescue cat Dr. Lavigne adopted needs care after its double amputation.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: In Van Zandt County, Herchman discovers a woman sleeping in her car who may be under the influence of drugs. Plus, a man is found with several outstanding warrants.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: A couple dreams of a treehouse that will recapture mountain vistas. Pete creates a bungalow with large windows to take in a view that was once lost.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: When Kanani is in a serious motorcycle accident, Tia and the Villalobos crew must band together to ensure him a speedy recovery. Plus, an ex-marine looks for a dog.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson enters Ellen’s world, one that’s crawling with neighborhood feral cats, who she’s been feeding and trying to contain virtually by herself for 20 years; a pair of hairless Donskoy cats who are treating their guardians home like it’s a party zone.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Terri welcomes Mballa, a new cheetah cub from South Africa, to the Australia Zoo family. Meanwhile, Robert sets out to save a stranded platypus.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff helps Lola who needs major surgery on her kidneys and Dr Amy meets Bobo who’s badly wounded after a cat fight. Animal control brings in a neglected dog, Juicy.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: The Imaginarium Science Center requests a giant ship-shaped tank with a replica of the USCGC Mohawk inside, which proves to be an ocean-sized headache for ATM.

programme.title: Baby Pandas First Year
programme.desc: Following on from A Panda is Born this documentary tracks baby panda, Tai Shan, as he passes some important milestones to becoming an adult.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Unseasonably warm weather drives Jim to the Brooks Range to look for potential landing strips. Plus, Ferno and Ariel prepare an Eskimo feast for pilot Johns return.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Yuki the bulldog ate something she shouldnt have, now Dr. Blue needs to find it. And, the rescue cat Dr. Lavigne adopted needs care after its double amputation.

programme.title: In Search Of Monsters
programme.desc: Recently disclosed audio recordings and astonishing photographs may provide the most conclusive evidence to date that the Ozark Howler may have demonic origins.

programme.title: Animal ER
programme.desc: Rover a young working dog, who has fallen over a cliff, is brought into the hospital. Surgeon Annette operates successfully but when Rover relapses can he be saved?

programme.title: Im Alive
programme.desc: Follow two incredible tales of survival and the determination to stay alive.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: A successful American football player, Clay Matthews, is in the process of building his dream home and wants a dream aquarium to match.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr Ross treats a rainforest mammal known as a kinkajou nearing its terrible twos. Dr Lavine is faced with a cat with a suspected contagious disease.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr. Ross and vet tech Kyrra rust to save the life of a stray cat injured by a car engine. And, Dr. Blue treats a 700lb pig who suffers from arthritis.

programme.title: Baby Pandas First Year
programme.desc: Following on from A Panda is Born this documentary tracks baby panda, Tai Shan, as he passes some important milestones to becoming an adult.

programme.title: Frenzy
programme.desc: Un insaisissable "tueur à la cravate" defraye la chronique londonienne.

programme.title: Le paradoxe des libellules
programme.desc: Elles sont aeriennes et aquatiques, combattantes et danseuses, tour à tour demonstratives et incroyablement discrètes. Entre enchantement et sentiment durgence, la vie vertigineuses des libellules menacees dextinction.

programme.title: Les promesses de la terre
programme.desc: Territoires intermediaires entre plaines et montagnes, les plateaux forment de vastes etendues où l’elevage s’est impose comme l’une des principales activites. Mais, très exposes au vent et au soleil, ces grands espaces subissent aujourd’hui de plein fouet le derèglement climatique.

programme.title: Les vagues scelerates, un mystère de taille
programme.desc: En haute mer, enquete sur les vagues scelerates. Cauchemar de tous les marins, elles peuvent atteindre la taille dun immeuble de dix etages, soit près de 35 mètres de haut. Veritables murs deau surgissant de nulle part, elles menacent meme les bateaux les plus modernes.

programme.title: ARTE Regards
programme.desc: La petite île ecossaise de North Uist s’apprete à accueillir une rampe de lancement de fusees. Plante au coeur d’une nature encore sauvage, ce chantier deplaît à de nombreux habitants, inquiets pour la serenite des lieux. Pourtant, cette terre isolee a desesperement besoin d’un nouveau souffle economique.

programme.title: ARTE Journal Junior du mercredi
programme.desc: Nicolas Sarkozy a ete president de la France entre 2007 et 2012. Il vient detre condamne par un tribunal pour avoir commis un grave delit : il aurait obtenu illegalement de largent pour financer sa campagne presidentielle. Bien quil ait lintention de contester ce jugement devant une cour dappel, il a ete incarcere ce mardi.

programme.title: GEO Reportage
programme.desc: Au pays des kangourous, des artistes urbains transforment dimmenses silos à grain en veritables œuvres d’art. Dans les regions les plus reculees, ils reinjectent ainsi de la vie et des couleurs à des lieux qui en manquent cruellement.

programme.title: Voyage en cuisine
programme.desc: "Voyage en cuisine" nous emmène dans les cuisines du monde entier, à la decouverte de recettes traditionnelles et de leurs origines. La boulette des Libanais du Bresil : le quibe - Le goût du pays : Mariele, une Bresilienne à Paris.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. En Éthiopie, Corto Maltese prend vie - Le football, ciment du Portugal - En Colombie, le poisson farci de Cecilia - À Agen, on en voit de toutes les couleurs.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. Bella Bellow, etoile musicale du Togo - New York lève le rideau du theâtre yiddish - Au Bresil, les gâteaux au cacao de Monica - En Inde, le sanguinaire Vasco de Gama.

programme.title: Kerry, un royaume sauvage en Irlande
programme.desc: Situe dans l’ouest de l’Irlande, le comte du Kerry offre au fil des saisons un spectacle en perpetuelle transformation. De la côte rocheuse à la plus haute chaîne de montagnes du pays, en passant par des tourbières reputees hantees et de mysterieuses forets de chenes, un voyage envoûtant dans la region la plus occidentale d’Irlande, où defilent blaireaux, macareux et busards.

programme.title: Irlande, la vie sauvage des Burren
programme.desc: LIrlande recèle lun des plus grands tresors naturels : un desert de pierre grise qui abrite certains des animaux sauvages les plus enchanteurs de l’île d’emeraude.

programme.title: Irlande, lhomme qui ecoute les oiseaux
programme.desc: Un jeune ornithologue irlandais sillonne son île pour enregistrer le chant d’environ deux cents espèces d’oiseaux, dont beaucoup sont menacees de disparaître. Un hymne sonore et visuel à une nature en sursis.

programme.title: L’archipel d’Hawaï
programme.desc: L’île dHawaï, aussi appelee "Big Island", est la plus etendue de l’archipel du meme nom. Le volcan qu’elle abrite, le Kilauea, est très actif ; autour du cratère, quelques rares promeneurs profitent de paysages grandioses, à l’instar de la New-Yorkaise Jade Chen.

programme.title: ARTE Regards
programme.desc: Chaque annee, les rescapes de la tragedie qui avait bouleverse l’Europe en 2013 se retrouvent à Lampedusa. Près de 370 personnes avaient peri lors du naufrage de leur embarcation au large de l’île italienne. Ce jour-là, 47 migrants ont ete sauves par le pecheur Vito Fiorino. Depuis, ils reviennent chaque annee et retrouvent celui qui est devenu leur "père".

programme.title: Maître Conti
programme.desc: Contactee par un père convaincu de l’innocence de son fils, incarcere pour meurtre depuis neuf ans, la celèbre avocate de Hambourg Anna Conti va tenter de faire eclater la verite.

programme.title: L’archipel d’Hawaï
programme.desc: Situees au centre de l’archipel, les îles Maui et Molokai ont des attraits bien distincts. La première est très prisee des surfeurs : Archie Kalepa y savoure les grosses vagues depuis de nombreuses annees. La musique et la danse de l’île sont egalement très reputees. La deuxième île, Molokai, est bien plus calme : avec un seul et unique hôtel, elle a ete très preservee du tourisme.

programme.title: La Mongolie, voyage au pays des nomades
programme.desc: Un million de nomades continuent de parcourir les steppes de Mongolie avec leurs troupeaux. Suivant le quotidien de l’une de ces familles, ce documentaire nous entraîne aussi jusqu’à Oulan-Bator, la capitale, où un adolescent apprend le chant diphonique traditionnel, et dans le sillage d’inspecteurs de l’environnement qui patrouillent à moto autour du lac Khovsgol.

programme.title: Le ventre de Francfort
programme.desc: Situe en plein centre de Francfort, le marche Kleinmarkthalle regorge de specialites regionales : les saucisses de Francfort, la sauce verte aux sept herbes aromatiques ou encore le Frankfurter Kranz, le celèbre gâteau de genoise en forme de couronne.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. La Nouvelle-Zelande metissee de Keri Hulme - Au Mexique, l’art de la ceramique noire - À Madère, la polenta et les chinchards de Maria - Au Japon, une imposture prehistorique.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. Orchestra Baobab, bande originale du Senegal - En Turquie, des hommes mènent la danse - Aux Philippines, la soupe au pied de bœuf de Casiano - À Brest, la guerre fait surface.

programme.title: Voyage en cuisine
programme.desc: "Voyage en cuisine" nous emmène dans les cuisines du monde entier, à la decouverte de recettes traditionnelles et de leurs origines. La tarte au citron de Floride : la Key lime pie - Le goût du pays : Heather, une Floridienne au Portugal.

programme.title: Le dessous des images
programme.desc: Une prison iranienne bombardee par Israël ? En juin 2025, cette video generee par lintelligence artificielle a trompe de nombreux medias et responsables politiques. Son succès met en lumière le rôle croissant de l’IA dans la desinformation en temps de guerre.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: 28 minutes
programme.desc: Presente par Élisabeth Quin du lundi au jeudi et Renaud Dely les vendredi et samedi, le rendez-vous quotidien consacre à l’actualite et au debat.

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes - Lessentiel
programme.desc: Un coup de projecteur sur un element important de l’actualite internationale en train de se produire.

programme.title: Une affaire privee
programme.desc: Galice dans les annees 40. Marina Quiroga, une jeune femme de la haute societe qui a lâme dune detective decide, avec son fidèle majordome Hector, de pieger le tueur qui terrorise la ville.

programme.title: Les filles d’Olfa
programme.desc: La vie d’Olfa, Tunisienne et mère de quatre filles, oscille entre ombre et lumière. Un jour, ses deux filles aînees disparaissent. Pour combler leur absence, la realisatrice Kaouther Ben Hania convoque des actrices professionnelles et met en place un dispositif de cinema hors du commun afin de lever le voile sur l’histoire d’Olfa et ses filles. Un voyage intime fait d’espoir, de rebellion, de violence, de transmission et de sororité qui va questionner le fondement meme de nos societes.

programme.title: Entre deux feux
programme.desc: Le depart au Kurdistan d’une jeune Allemande d’origine irakienne sur les traces de sa sœur, engagee dans les milices feminines combattant Daech. Une fiction nerveuse et sensible, qui questionne la perte d’identite des exiles.

programme.title: Pianoforte : le concours Frederic-Chopin à Varsovie
programme.desc: Une immersion de plusieurs semaines dans le quotidien de six jeunes pianistes qui passent le très renomme concours Chopin de Varsovie.

programme.title: Larchipel dHawaï
programme.desc: La troisième plus grande île de l’archipel, Oahu, abrite Honolulu, la capitale de ce qui est aussi le 50e État americain. Situee sur la côte sud, elle est particulièrement reputee pour son quartier de Waikiki, separe du reste de la ville par un canal, qui compte un port et une plage paradisiaque.

programme.title: Les maîtres des abeilles
programme.desc: En Argentine, la transhumance au fil de l’eau de centaines d’apiculteurs dans un veritable eden pour les abeilles...

programme.title: Les energies de la mer, toujours en lice ?
programme.desc: Parviendrons-nous un jour à produire de l’electricite à grande echelle en utilisant la puissance des oceans ? Un etat des lieux des echecs et des percees novatrices en la matière.

programme.title: ARTE Regards
programme.desc: Chaque annee, les rescapes de la tragedie qui avait bouleverse l’Europe en 2013 se retrouvent à Lampedusa. Près de 370 personnes avaient peri lors du naufrage de leur embarcation au large de l’île italienne. Ce jour-là, 47 migrants ont ete sauves par le pecheur Vito Fiorino. Depuis, ils reviennent chaque annee et retrouvent celui qui est devenu leur "père".

programme.title: ARTE Journal Junior
programme.desc: Le JT matinal et quotidien de six minutes pour les 10-14 ans.

programme.title: GEO Reportage
programme.desc: Le volcan Iodake occupe plus de la moitie de la surface de l’île de Satsuma Iwojima, au sud-ouest du Japon. Ses habitants ont vecu de l’extraction du soufre pendant presque un millenaire avant que l’activite ne decline. Si nombre d’entre eux ont quitte leur île natale, d’autres s’emploient à y attirer des touristes et de nouveaux residents.

programme.title: Voyage en cuisine
programme.desc: "Voyage en cuisine" nous emmène dans les cuisines du monde entier, à la decouverte de recettes traditionnelles et de leurs origines. La tarte au citron de Floride : la Key lime pie - Le goût du pays : Heather, une Floridienne au Portugal.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. Orchestra Baobab, bande originale du Senegal - En Turquie, des hommes mènent la danse - Aux Philippines, la soupe au pied de bœuf de Casiano - À Brest, la guerre fait surface.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. La Nouvelle-Zelande metissee de Keri Hulme - Au Mexique, l’art de la ceramique noire - À Madère, la polenta et les chinchards de Maria - Au Japon, une imposture prehistorique.

programme.title: LAfrique vue du ciel
programme.desc: Des immenses etendues naturelles sauvages aux megalopoles, une decouverte spectaculaire du continent africain depuis le ciel.

programme.title: Caracal, la societe du chat solitaire
programme.desc: Dans les savanes d’Afrique du Sud, une jeune femelle caracal s’essaie aux rudiments de la chasse. Après avoir essuye de multiples revers, risquant à tout moment d’etre devoree par un lion, elle effectue une longue peregrination vers le sud et decouvre la banlieue de la ville du Cap… et ses multiples opportunites.

programme.title: Kenya, gardiennes des elephants
programme.desc: Dans la reserve kenyane du Namunyak, refuge des pachydermes, la secheresse menace les humains comme les animaux. Ce documentaire suit deux gardiennes d’elephanteaux qui luttent sans relâche pour proteger l’avenir de tous.

programme.title: ARTE Regards
programme.desc: En Roumanie, la stigmatisation des troubles psychiques reste profonde, et ceux qui en souffrent trop souvent relegues en marge de la societe. Ciprian Hord, psychologue et photographe, travaille dans un hôpital. Arme de son appareil photo, de son empathie et de sa creativite, il capture des fragments d’humanite, des eclats de dignite retrouvee et offre aux malades un nouvel espace d’expression.

programme.title: Meurtre mysterieux à Manhattan
programme.desc: Carol Lipton sinteresse à la mort subite de sa voisine, au grand damne de son voisin, qui aurait prefere que lon enterre laffaire.

programme.title: Les delices d’Émilie-Romagne
programme.desc: Un delicieux voyage à la croisee des traditions culinaires du nord de lItalie. Cet episode nous emmène à Parme et dans louest de lÉmilie-Romagne, où se deploie une grande diversite de paysages, dont la celèbre plaine du Pô. Au menu : des tagliatelles issues de varietes anciennes de cereales, du parmesan au lait de vache rousse et le gâteau rouge de Langhirano.

programme.title: Le ventre de Porto
programme.desc: À Porto, le Mercado do Bolhao a rouvert ses portes en 2022, après une minutieuse restauration. Symbole des traditions culinaires et culturelles de la region du Douro, on y trouve des sardines, des tripes ou des broa de Avintes, petits pains de seigle et de maïs.

programme.title: Le ventre de Rome
programme.desc: Plus grand marche de la Ville Éternelle, le Mercato Trionfale represente l’essence de la cuisine romaine, des artichauts au baccalà (morue salee), en passant par le pecorino romano (fromage de brebis sale) ou la porchetta, à base de cochon de lait.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. La psychose new-yorkaise de Bret Easton Ellis - Au Benin, la Route de l’esclave - À Tourcoing, la fricadelle au maroilles de Corentin et Laurence - En Slovenie, resister par la voix.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. Au Costa Rica, Walter Ferguson sacre roi du calypso - En Irak, Gertrude Bell dessine un pays - En Allemagne, le ragoût de poumon de veau de Susanne - À Cerbère, les oranges ont le goût de la revolte.

programme.title: Voyage en cuisine
programme.desc: "Voyage en cuisine" nous emmène dans les cuisines du monde entier, à la decouverte de recettes traditionnelles et de leurs origines. Le roi des poissons australiens : le barramundi - Le goût du pays : Daniel, un Australien à Athènes.

programme.title: Le dessous des images
programme.desc: En quelques annees, le QR code a envahi notre quotidien. Ces pixels noirs et blancs s’affichent dorenavant partout : commerces, restaurants ou encore cimetières. Mais que disent-ils de notre civilisation numerisee ? Retour sur ces petites images codees.

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: 28 minutes
programme.desc: Presente par Élisabeth Quin du lundi au jeudi et Renaud Dely les vendredi et samedi, le rendez-vous quotidien consacre à l’actualite et au debat.

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes - Lessentiel
programme.desc: Un coup de projecteur sur un element important de l’actualite internationale en train de se produire.

programme.title: The Deal
programme.desc: Avril 2015. Un « round de la dernière chance » reunit à Genève les États-Unis, l’Iran, l’Europe, la Russie et la Chine afin d’encadrer le programme nucleaire de l’Iran, soupçonne de vouloir se doter de l’arme atomique. Cheffe du protocole suisse, Alexandra Weiss orchestre dans l’ombre ces negociations sous haute tension, sans se douter que des espions ont pour mission de les faire echouer. Alors qu’Alexandra est propulsee à la tete de la mission diplomatique suisse, un ingenieur iranien rejoint la table des negociations.

programme.title: The Deal
programme.desc: Alexandra est bouleversee par l’arrivee inattendue du nouvel ingenieur, Payam Sanjabi, affaibli par un sejour dans les prisons de Teheran. Alexandra tente de lui parler, mais celui-ci est sous constante surveillance. Mohsem Mahdavi, le Ministre des Affaires etrangères iranien, doit regler des difficultes familiales et fait appel à Babak Pirouz, un homme d’affaires douteux. Prive de son passeport, Sanjabi supplie Alexandra de lui venir en aide.

programme.title: The Deal
programme.desc: L’Iran tire un missile vers le Golan et les negociations sont sur le point de s’arreter. Cindy Cohen, Sous-secretaire d’État americaine, met la pression sur Mahdavi pour tenter de les sauver. Andrew Porter, representant du Tresor americain, fait une rencontre nocturne qui ne tarde pas à le mettre dans l’embarras. Alors que les services de renseignements israeliens cherchent par tous les moyens à savoir ce qui se trame à la table des negociations, Alexandra trouve un stratagème pour voir Sanjabi dans l’intimite.

programme.title: Freddie Mercury, The Great Pretender
programme.desc: À base darchives et de temoignages rares, un portrait passionnant de Freddie Mercury (1946-1991), le legendaire leader de Queen, enigmatique icône musicale aux multiples facettes.

programme.title: Les super-predateurs des mers
programme.desc: Dans les eaux qui bordent l’Alaska, les baleines chassent ensemble. Dans le detroit de Chatham, une equipe de biologistes et de bioacousticiens etudie les techniques de chasse collective des baleines à bosse afin de mieux comprendre comment ces cetaces communiquent entre eux et se coordonnent.

programme.title: Les super-predateurs des mers
programme.desc: Une plongee dans les secrets de l’intelligence animale, à la decouverte des incroyables strategies de chasse deployees par les predateurs marins. Tourne en Argentine, dans la baie de Puerto Madryn, cet episode decrypte la technique d’echouage des orques, et revèle avec des images aeriennes comment, au sein du clan, elle se transmet aux jeunes, futurs chasseurs.

programme.title: Les super-predateurs des mers
programme.desc: Les effets du changement climatique mettent en presence des espèces qui ne se sont jamais rencontrees auparavant.

programme.title: Des animaux et des arbres
programme.desc: Traversee dimages spectaculaires, cette immersion dans la foret gaspesienne, au Canada, revèle les liens etonnants quentretiennent les arbres et les animaux.

programme.title: Les animaux de l’aeroport
programme.desc: Lapins, renards, campagnols, herissons, chevreuils, etourneaux, rapaces... : les aeroports abritent une biodiversite insoupçonnee. À travers les yeux d’un renard aventureux, une malicieuse exploration de la faune qui peuple les abords des aeroports.

programme.title: Rick Steins Long Weekends
programme.desc: The chef heads to Cadiz in Spain, where he samples two of the citys most revered culinary stars - fresh tuna and Manzanilla sherry. Rick is captivated by the narrow winding streets as he walks in the footsteps of the ancient Phoenician and Arab traders, whose influence on the city can still be seen to this day. Back home, he prepares flamenco eggs and arroz verde, or green rice, made with garlic, parsley, clams and prawns, producing the vibrant colours of the Spanish flag.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The extraordinary animals from a tablet game come to life after the device explodes.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy discovers in shock that the TV has been replaced with a trompe-l’oeil image. programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Like a big brother, Jerry gets a sleepy Tuffy out of bed, makes them both breakfast, gets Tuffy cleaned up, puts on his backpack and scoots him past the mean ol cat to the house next door where WINSTON waits, greeting his students, a gaggle of mice, including Jerry. They each hand their kindly teacher a treat as they take their seats on little spools of thread, ready for the start of class. Winston is teaching his students the basics of force and motion, and today theyre going on a field trip to see physics in action. They end up at Toms house where Tom bears the brunt of the school load until he gets a little tutoring himself.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Jerry gets a cold he gets no help from Tom who chooses instead to use the mouses down time to taunt the little guy and eat all of his favorite treats. As a side effect of the Tabasco fueled brew, the mouse is breathing fire within minutes. When Tom catches the same cold and gets a dose of the brew, its an all-out flame war! Good thing Uncle Pecos is there to put the fire out!

Unless you count "literally turning into a monster every time you hiccup" as "better". No point sitting around shedding on the furniture: Specs puts his newly monsterific buddy to good use as a Lamput-hunter. Which goes well until Skinny gets better. If you count being chased off into the distance by an angry bear as "better".

programme.desc: Its back to basics as Specs attempts to catch Lamput with a net. Not being much good at anything at all physical, Specs ends up whacking himself on his own noggin. Skinny and Lamput have to learn on the job. Taking care of a baby is hard. Especially if its a giant annoying one.

Grizzy and Lemmings set out to find the sacred ingredients but there is no question of working together. May the best critter win!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: “Chasing Lamput” turns out to be the ultimate backstage pass; the Docs pursue the orange blob through the dressing room and directly onto the stage of a gigantic stadium rock concert. The crowd goes wild. Which raises questions about their taste in music, to be honest; Skinny plays guitar like he’s gotten himself tangled in the strings (which he has), and Specs’ drumming, well, it’s certainly got passion. No taste, skill or rhythm, but certainly passion. The stage ends up in tatters by the time the actual band arrives. Those Docs are a hard act to follow.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Not easy to enjoy a DVD about salmon when the Lemmings are having a disco party right there. Grizzy sends them packing with such force that they land at the research station, where they discover a state-of-the-art U.V. cabin. When turned up to the max, the light therapy and music options can advantageously replace the disco equipment Grizzy destroyed. The noise they make causes a block of ice to break off. It hurdles down the slope to the cabin and destroys Grizzy’s TV. But it doesn’t take the bear long to figure out that the U.V. cabin also has a DVD function.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have fun destroying ice towers. When Grizzy sees them, it inspires him to sculpt statues of himself. The Lemmings cannot resist the temptation to destroy the statues of Grizzy, who does everything in his power to protect them.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A container adrift along the icefield will change the lives of Grizzy and the Lemmings: it’s an inexhaustible stock of chocolate spread! There is so much, that for the first time the close enemies have no need to fight over the treat. They entice a flock of penguins into hoisting the container out of the water. One of the penguins, who did not get his reward in fish, is disgruntled. Grizzy has him taste the Yummy, then throws the jar far away to get rid of the penguin. The chocolate treat spreads over the icefield. Fatal error?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy uses a fire extinguisher to chase the Lemmings from the living room so that he can take a nap, but the gadget accidentally flies out the window. It lands at the top of an ice cliff, causing a fissure, and the peak of the cliff topples. Amid the debris, the Lemmings discover a fearsome creature: the Yeti, who is looking for the guilty party. The Lemmings bring him to Grizzy, never dreaming that the giant will immediately fall in love with the Ranger’s cabin and throw a very original party.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy decides to adopt a coconut. The Lemmings decide to hide inside other coconuts to be adopted too!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy pretends to have a twisted ankle so that the Lemmings have to take care of him.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings have set up a mini-fair but Grizzy steals the Lemmings tickets in order to hit the jackpot

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When all of the Batwheels (except for Bam) mysteriously disappear, Bam enlists the help of A.D.A.M, the original Batmobile, to help save his friends. Along the way, Bam comes to appreciate the old-school mobiles different crimefighting style as they team up to take on the Legion of Zoom.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Much to everyone’s surprise, Bam is secretly afraid of the dark. When Poison Ivy knocks out all the power in Gotham, Bam must conquer his fears to stop her.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Redbird tries his hand at espionage as “V-8, the Super-Spy”, he quickly realizes hes gotten in over his head.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi has a terrible no-good day after she keeps messing up and lets Joker get away. She doesn’t think he can help Batgirl anymore, but a “bad today” doesn’t mean it’ll be a “bad tomorrow".

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Pro snowboarder Pepper Polar Bear hires The Looney Builders to build a ski resort. Pepper soon learns that others have different skill levels.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Wile E. Coyote hires The Looney Builders to build him a house in the desert so he can be alone. The Road Runner tries to pay him a visit causing Wile E. to heighten his security measures.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired by the town’s volunteer firefighters to build a fire truck. Duty calls and they build on the go as they make rescues throughout Looneyburg.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Witch Hazel hires The Looney Builders to make her house look spooky for Halloween.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Waffles is worried that his roommate Bo had his brain eaten by aliens, leaving him a zombie dog. Turns out hes not the first dog in his neighborhood to wake up stupid. Afraid of becoming the next Bo, Waffles hires the Cat and Mouse Detectives to put a stop to this alien invasion. Our Narrator thinks all of this extraterrestrial talk is a load of sci-fi hooey but not our detectives; theyre covering all their bases and taking every necessary precaution. Turns out the dogs behavior has more to do with a tainted bag of kibble than visitors from another planet… or does it?

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Butch finds a wish bone in the garbage and dupes Tom into believing that it will make his wishes come true. Butch trades Tom the bone for a dozen cans of cat food. The alley cat thinks hes pulled off the best scam ever UNTIL Toms wishes start coming true (from Jerry getting his just dessert to Toodles paying an unexpected visit)! Now Butch will stop at nothing to get that bone back!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Rick uploads a video of Tom getting his head stuck in Jerrys mouse hole, the video instantly goes viral and Tom becomes the laughing stock of the feline community. Now Tom must restore his reputation by catching Jerry and capturing it all on video. Easier said than done.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When a Hare loses to a Tortoise in the biggest race of the year, he comes to Tom and Jerry claiming foul play. Its up to the duo to see whats really behind the most famous race in history.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Hildie and Beatie return from the Ol Time Goblin Fair with kettle corn, a giant stuffed warlock, and a piranha they won in the ball toss. Despite their warning not to touch the fish, Tom cant pass up a chance to eat the catch of the day! But first he has to get past Jerry who is determined to protect his new friend. When a failed attempt by Tom ends up with the fish bowl being shattered, Jerry quickly casts a spell with the wand that allows the fish to breathe on dry land! The liberated fish is excited to explore his newfound freedom (walking on his tail fin) and ends up making life a lot more complicated for Jerry whos trying to protect him!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom and Butch both set out to win Toodles affection while Jerry plays Cyrano to Winston to help him get over his nerves.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Glitchs compartment empties out and a huge amount of junk floats out, Ella suggests that Slippy get rid of it. They all head to Vesta. Madhu finds something that looks like a robot so the gang sets out to find the other pieces.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella, Tilly, Slippy and Madhu are playing a game on the moon when it starts to rumble. The ground cracks open, and they fall into what they discover is a large network of tunnels underground.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Angelie breaks Slippys Jupiter gliding record, hes equally upset and fascinated by her surfboard. The two agree on a rematch and set out to work on their vehicles. They both ask Ella for help.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella finds her Nannys old Hide and Peek device and hopes to beat Slippys record for Hide and Seek! Gem and I.Lo are playing too. Slippy decides to make things more interesting by siphoning fuel from the Hide and Peek.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Glitch’s compartment empties out and a huge amount of junk floats out, Ella suggests that Slippy get rid of it. They all head to Vesta. Slippy is enchanted by the amount of stuff on the planetoid. Madhu finds something that looks like a robot so the gang sets out to find the other pieces. They quickly put together an impressive robot they call Victor. Victor is designed to recycle and he happily does just that. But when Slippy brings him back to the Clubhouse, they soon realise Victor needs to be in his home.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its a stormy day, and Toad ignores Rattys instructions to tie the sail down. The sail takes off, taking Ratty, Mole, and Hedge with it. Toad has to take to the skies himself in order to save his friends.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its time for Adder to shed her itchy skin, but the other Riverbankers fail to understand why she is so grumpy and continually interrupt her peace and quiet.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Ratty and his brother, Reggie, take Toads caravan on a trip through the countryside, sibling jealousies rise to the surface.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When Toad finds hes related to royalty, his airs and graces offend his friends.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: When a duckling imprints on Toad, he finds himself with an adoring fan. In trying to rehome the duckling on the river, Toad puts it in grave danger.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean tries to learn skateboarding but hurts himself.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket becomes inconsolable when Scrapper goes missing. Mr Bean investigates.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean discovers Mrs. Wicket’s nephew and Bruiser Jnr swapping football stickers and decides that he wants to fill up a sticker album too.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean thinks he’s just dug up a valuable coin in the back-garden and goes rushing off to the Museum to have it valued.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Glitchs compartment empties out and a huge amount of junk floats out, Ella suggests that Slippy get rid of it. They all head to Vesta. Madhu finds something that looks like a robot so the gang sets out to find the other pieces.

programme.desc: Biblical texts describe winged creatures carrying messages from the heavens. But are angels merely the product of the imagination - or do they really exist?

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Perhaps the greatest unexplained mystery of all is: what happens to us after we die? Perhaps clues to the answer lie in unusual cases of near-death experience.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team probes some of the largest sightings of alleged UFOs ever recorded over the English Channel, including two eerie objects spotted by pilots in 2007.

programme.title: Project Impossible
programme.desc: A new class of super structures are taking on the impossible: the largest moveable building in history, a super-tall skyscraper built to withstand killer earthquakes, and a bridge being raised while it stays open to traffic.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: The quest for the one of the largest treasures in modern day history continues. The Lost Gold of World War II returns to resume the search for hundreds of billions of dollars of stolen loot supposedly hidden by Japanese General Tomoyuki Yamashita.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: An investigation into reports from India of encounters with a ferocious half-man, half-ape creature dubbed the monkey man.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: In the heart of the Mediterranean, a peaceful island explodes with devastating force - it will be the biggest volcanic eruption in three and a half thousand years of recorded history.

programme.desc: In this episode, our experts cook up ten ways you could destroy the earth, including swallowing it with a microscopic black hole, blowing it up with anti-matter, hurling it into the Sun, and switching off gravity.

programme.desc: Mother Nature attacks Gulf Coast residents with the worst hurricane in US history; a tornado rips through a hardware store, turning merchandise into lethal weapons; and in Haiti, a monstrous earthquake claims countless victims.

programme.desc: The team heads to Colorado Springs to search for the remains of Nikola Teslas mysterious laboratory and attempt to prove that Teslas design for generating wireless electricity actually works.

programme.desc: Hunting for the Lost Dutchman is usually a one-man journey, but Wayne Tuttle is partnering with a team of experts to follow a newly-revealed clue that could finally solve the 500-year-old mystery of Americas most famous buried treasure.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: A search through the jungles of Central Africa for an elusive monster said to resemble an enormous, long-necked and four-legged saurpod dinosaur.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: Religion, mythology, art, power and science all influenced the Seven Wonders of the World. Their engineering still astounds us today.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: The Universe is full of explosions that both create and destroy. This is a countdown of 10 of the biggest, most powerful types of blasts to rock the cosmos.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ruins in Peru support legends of a sunken UFO base and Indian texts talk of water worlds populated by humans and aliens. Could aquatic cities prove that aliens visited?

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: 15,000 years ago man and the wolf form a partnership that shapes the future of Mankind. With the help of mans new best friend we domesticate more animals, sowing the first seeds of farming and civilisation.

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: The ability to share complicated ideas allowed early man to hunt, farm and build communities. And the creation of things like an alphabet and the printing press allow Mankind to further expand, leading to the proliferation of ideas and revolution.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Go beneath the jungles of Belize to uncover burial tombs, sacrificial altars, ritualistic caves and the literal entrances to the Mayan underworld.

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A set of replica Muppets has Chum green with envy; Will going gonzo over these furry friends land him the goods? When a pair of pants supposedly worn by Keith Richards rolls into the shop, Corey teaches Jake you cant always get what you want.

programme.title: Secrets Declassified With David Duchovny
programme.desc: Spy gadgets hide in plain sight: a toy saves an informant, wigs disguise agents, and a spy balloon sparks an alien conspiracy.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Millions of people around the world claim to have had an encounter with a creature unlike any recognized by mainstream science - such as the Mothman, Chupacabra, and Mongolian Death Worm.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens Special Presentation
programme.desc: From the furthest reaches of human history, our ancestors left curious carvings, geo-glyphs, and hieroglyphic messages for future generations to decipher. Is it possible that these relics indicate communication with extraterrestrial visitors?

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: While shocking events take place in the same location where the team has witnessed UAPs fly in and out of the Mesa, a cow is found to have died under very disturbing circumstances.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Ricks in the Big Apple to see if he can compute a deal on a rare piece of tech. Can this sweet piece tempt Rick or will he shut it down? A seller flies into the shop with a special edition Stan Lee Funko Pop. Will Corey make a super deal?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller strolls in with a collection of action figures signed by the cast of The Walking Dead, will Chum bite? Corey is too cool when a Rock n Roll High School poster comes into the shop. Will the deal be music to his ears?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: From a 500-ton stone believed to represent an ancient UFO, to giant statues said to have been created with advanced technology. Could these extraordinary standing stones provide evidence of extraterrestrial visitation?

programme.title: Kevin Costners The West
programme.desc: In northern Wyomings Powder River Valley, a group of ranchers band together to protect their rights to graze cattle; a powerful cabal of cattle barons smear the ranchers as common thieves and plot an invasion.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Dr. J. Allen Hynek was a pioneering scientist. Yet, he is best known as the notorious government UFO debunker who became one of the founding fathers of ufology. Was Dr. Hynek right when he concluded that there is a non-human intelligence on Earth?

programme.title: The Unbelievable With Dan Aykroyd
programme.desc: A blind man who uses bat-like powers of echolocation to navigate his surroundings, a samurai with reflexes faster than a speeding bullet, and a man whos immune to electrocution.

programme.desc: After a terrifying collapse, the Fellowship is finally at the precipice of the Solution Channel.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Perhaps the greatest unexplained mystery of all is: what happens to us after we die? Perhaps clues to the answer lie in unusual cases of near-death experience.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller comes in with a poster by Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, will it make an impression on Rick, or will he bid adieu? Meanwhile, Chum unboxes some 1912 Yale baseball uniforms. Is it a home run, or a strike out?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey take a spin in the classic car Hells Chariot, from the movie Grease. Is the flaming hotrod the one that they want, or will they "drop out" of the deal? Then, Chum takes a whack at a Punch-A-Bag game once played by Jack Dempsey.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Counting down ten of compelling - and covert - projects that study the UFO phenomenon; from clandestine government organisations to agents that silence UFO witnesses and secret programmes to reverse engineer alien technology.

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When the team deploys a cutting-edge new technology on Skinwalker Ranch to study the mysterious Bubble, it leads to an unsettling revelation.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Is famous footage of the Mississippi Bigfoot the real deal? Why did the White House order a UFO to be shot down over Lake Huron? What will forensic testing reveal about the alleged alien corpses presented to the Mexican government?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorists have suggested that many of the divine beings depicted in cultures throughout the world are not really divine - or mythological - but instead reflect extraterrestrial visitations that our ancestors did not understand.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick rocks out when a seller brings in a blazer worn by the Rolling Stones Keith Richards. Can he get some satisfaction, or will he exile the jacket? Then, a Japanese samurai mask hits the counter. Will Chum be able to scare up a good price?

programme.desc: Is famous footage of the Mississippi Bigfoot the real deal? Why did the White House order a UFO to be shot down over Lake Huron? What will forensic testing reveal about the alleged alien corpses presented to the Mexican government?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Its the Great Okido Sleepover only there is a loude noise keeping Messy awake! With the help of Zoom, Messy must track down the noise to save the sleepover.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apple Dumplin comes to visit her cousin Strawberry. Soon she causes trouble: she installs a light/music display in Strawberrys bedroom, but cannot turn it off; later she causes a power failure. After Apple leaves, it is revealed that she fixed the power.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry has a nightmare in which he is chased by a monster, so he goes to Dino World in an attempt to hide from it.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is upset to learn that he must return his library book so decides to hide the book in Dino-World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo is shocked to find an electric eel in the garden pond! The Junior Rangers travel to South America to return the eel to its home, but their mission takes a wild turn when they meet an anaconda.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Gordon is going about his usual business when something extraordinary happens – he can’t stop giggling! What starts as a little chuckle soon turns into full blown hysterics and… Gordon HATES IT! The more he tries to stop laughing, the worse it gets and he’s convinced if Sir Topham Hatt/Fat Controller sees him in this ‘silly’ state, he’ll take the Express from him and give him ‘silly’ jobs instead. Desperately, he heads to Steam Works to be fixed, where he learns that a little bit of laughter doesn’t do anybody any harm!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In Brazil, Thomas meets Gustavo, a big, blue engine who reminds him very much of Gordon.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: When Stella and David find a seagull that can’t fly, Grisu becomes the bird’s flight instructor. The little dragon tries all kinds of ways to coax the bird to fly, but nothing works. Grisu decides the bird needs to understand the feeling of flight, so he builds a large hang glider and takes the bird for a ride in the sky. Fume is so delighted to see his son in the air that he flies up to him, scaring Grisu and the bird…which causes Grisu to burn the hang glider. Thanks to all Grisu has show the seagull, the bird spreads its wings and flies. But will Grisu…?

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Stranavoce is to do a recital in the main square, accompanied on the piano by Stella. David, her daughter and Grisu drive to Stranavoces to get his piano and move it to the venue. But David suddenly has to go on an emergency and takes the singer – who wants to rehearse at the main square – with him. So Stella and Grisu decide to move the piano (its on wheels) all by themselves. They soon hit a slope and cant push the piano up it. Fume comes in and without being asked, pushes the piano up the hill with the kids on it. But then Fume trips and the piano rolls down the other side, ending up in a haystack by the farm.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Scoutbadger is angry with Martis who prefers to play a game with Loudo. Scoutbadger hates this game and wants his friend, his very best friend, not to play it and spend more time with him.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Jenny Dobbs, the zoo keeper, asks Bob to finish building the new bear enclosure at Spring City zoo. He plans a three-tiered natural habitat that resembles a rocky mountain, with a pool and cave for shelter. Scoop thinks the mountain needs to be a tall as possible in order to keep the bear happy, and he convinces Muck and Lofty to help him. Unfortunately they build it too high. The rocks and soil in-fill cant take the weight and the whole mountain collapses. Scoop apologises, but Bob quite likes the idea of a bigger structure and alters the design so they can re-build the mountain with four levels. They finish just in time as a crate carrying the bear arrives.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are completing work on a brand new fitness trail in the sports stadium park. They must finish before the afternoon’s Spring City Fun Run - a steeplechase across the fitness trail obstacle course, organised by Scoop’s idol Skye Sampson, a fitness guru and world champion record-breaking athlete. When Scoop is told that only humans will be competing, he sets up his own competition: the Muscle Machine Games! With events including “Weightlifting” (with a pallet of wooden beams) and “Discuss Throw” (with an old tyre) Lofty and Muck both break new records...

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Hilda arrives at Sallys dance party, shes suddenly struck with a severe case of the sneezes. Thinking shes come down with a cold, her friends take her to Doctor Lion who informs her she has an allergy to something. It turns out shes allergic to her best friend Sally - or rather, the new rose-scented perfume Sallys wearing./Huckle, Lowly and Sally find they have their mystery-solving hands full when things start disappearing, in the blink of an eye!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo discovers a reef manta ray pup in the garden. The Junior Rangers set sail to find the manta ray a home in the ocean, but what happens when Ranger Rocky gets stuck in a sea jelly bloom?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Ranger Rocky entrusts the Junior Rangers with a mission—return a mola to the ocean! The Junior Rangers take up the challenge, but find themselves having to wing it when some seagulls start pecking the mola.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is playing cars with his friend and neighbor Ferdinand. Suddenly, he really really has to go pee. When he returns from the bathroom though, Ferdinand is no longer there. And Simon’s car has disappeared! Persuaded that Ferdinand has stolen it from him, Simon decides to lead an investigation. He goes over to Ferdinand’s house and searches everywhere for it. But no matter how hard he looks, no-go, he can’t find it. And what’s worse, Ferdinand is playing like nothing is wrong! When he returns home, super annoyed, what should Simon find in the bathroom, exactly where he left it, but his…car! He had totally forgotten.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win."

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing loves Arlo the cat. They are friends. Bing strokes the kitty and they play hide and seek, but what happens when Bing meets a cat that isnt as friendly?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: As Rupert would prefer to read than go out for a walk with Tilda, he pretends to have a cold. At once, Tilda declares herself his nurse and makes tea for him, gives him nose massages and makes him gargle, take cold foot baths and do a special keep fit programme.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Spring has arrived and Tilda fervently wants to paint a white sheep on a green meadow. She grabs her easel and sets off. Her friends may have lots of other suggestions for things she could paint, but she has her heart set on a sheep. Her friend Patrick the sheep turns out to be a difficult model: he just cant keep still.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Molly visits Tilda, her friend is looking for a birthday present for Rupert. In the end, Tilda decides on a blue scarf. Molly suggests sending Rupert the present as a parcel to make the surprise all the bigger. A great idea, thinks Tilda.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare, Little Field Mouse and Big Nutbrown Hare go up to high meadow with Big Nutbrown Hare they get caught in the mist. It’s a little scary so they hold hands and pass the time by playing guessing games. As the mist starts to lift, they see a beautiful circle rainbow around the sun.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is excited because Big Nutbrown Hare has agreed to meet him later to play games. When his father arrives to tell him a storm is coming and he needs to gather food instead, Little Nutbrown Hare is hiding so Big Nutbrown Hare leaves. He searches the meadow for his father, more and more disappointed, but when he learns why Big Nutbrown Hare couldn’t play this time, he understands.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse discover creatures that can blend in with their surroundings and are inspired to learn just where they can blend in. Little Nutbrown hare becomes disappointed when his white fluffy tail and his dark brown ear tips give him away each time. That’s until he discovers the reeds by the river are exactly the right height and colours to camouflage him perfectly.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot must decide the best order in which to do three jobs: pick up the Mayor, clean the tunnel with the scrub-a-chug and have a chugwash. Deciding they should look their best for the Mayor, they have a chugwash first. Then they clean the tunnels – which gets them filthy again! They’re afraid they won’t earn their badges – until they use the scrub-a-chug to clean themselves. Now sparkling, they pick up the Mayor and Vee awards them their badges!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In New Zealand, Kyle practices his boomerang skills on the beach, but it gets carried away into the forest. While searching for it, he stumbles upon two Yellow-Eyed Penguins in the middle of the forest with one shooing the other away. Puzzled by their presence, Kyle contacts the Junior Rangers, who, in the Garden, are dealing with Heros impatience for his repaired jetpack. During the call, they learn that the penguin might be looking for its nest but suddenly, it scurries off towards the beach. The team travels to New Zealand in PlatypusOne to assist Kyle and the penguin but it’s nowhere to be found now. They try to figure out where the nest could be while the poor lost penguin checks nests of other penguin and gets shooed off everytime. As an attempt to look for it better, they use their jetpacks, and Kyle climbs a tree to search from higher ground but discovers no leads. With help from Ranger Rocky and information from Ranger Joey, they decide to look inland and use PlatypusOne to search from a birds’ eye view and eventually, they successfully locate the penguin’s fledgling and nest which results in a heartwarming reunion. Back at the Treehouse, Leo hangs a picture of the new penguin friend, celebrating another successful wildlife rescue. Meanwhile, Hero, now equipped with a fixed jetpack, flies excitedly in the garden but gets himself stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the Alaskan wilderness, Jayden witnesses a grizzly bear cub being swept away in a river. Hero, Leo, and Katie, in the Garden, are practicing a search and rescue mission, with Heros flotation device when Jayden contacts them about the cub’s emergency. After a quick info segment about grizzly bears, they travel to Alaska in PlatypusOne. They try to chase after the cub but the river then divides into two ways. Unsure which way the cub went, the team split up with Katie and Hero flying ahead with their jetpacks to find the cub. Leo and Jayden then encounter Ranger Rocky who suggests they seek advice from Ranger Joey. Hero comes back to the boys and signals that he didn’t find the cub. Katie then joins them and warns them that the cub is approaching dangerous rapids. Hero is tasked to find the mother bear while the team rushes to the cub. When they reach the cub, it’s clinging to rocks as the rapids are pulling it away. They drop Heros flotation device and Hero practices his rescue skills, enabling the cub to safely reunite with its mother. Back at the Treehouse, they hang a picture of the rescued cub and its mom, concluding the successful mission and in the Garden, Hero is enjoying his well deserved time in the pool.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Fanni accidentally knocks over Tchoupi and Nina’s "cushion cabin," it prompts them to build a real cabin, in the forest, opening up a whole new adventure! However, when they get to the forest, Tchoupi grows increasingly scared after spotting a spider! In the end, however, he realizes that the animals of the forest are actually way more nervous than he is!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi misses out on going to the market with Fred, Nina decides to cheer him up by suggesting they "sell their wares at the market," like a couple of adults -right there, in the hamlet where they live! The friends find some great produce, which they then promptly sell to their parents. The latter are delighted with their wares; only problem is, Dad would have loved to be able to bake a yummy pie but has no eggs with which to make it…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out on a picnic with T’choupi and his family, plus Nina, Dad chances upon a four-leaf clover! He gifts it to Fanni as a lucky charm. As a result, convinced that he’s having a bad day, T’choupi is now determined to find a four-leaf clover of his own, to turn the tide and enjoy nothing but good fortune for the rest of the day!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: The children are all thrilled to see that basketball hoops have been set up in the school playground! All except Charley! His first try at making a shot is a fiasco and he therefore decides that he will not be participating in tomorrow’s game. Thank goodness Lily and, especially, Mimmo, are there…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia sleeps badly, disturbed by a nightmare that comes back every night. In order to help her find back her sleep and her dynamism, Sam invents a trap to capture bad dreams. Will it work?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have planned to play in their lair but Tonio wants to find out where it is! Noit so easy to fool him. But what if this game turns out to be even more fun than the one originally planned?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In an attempt to beat Thomas in a race, Cleo decides to use the railway lines instead of the road. She soon learns that the roads are much safer for a little car.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Nia uses what she learns about lighthouses to suggest covering a big wheel in Christmas lights, so Harold can see where he is going in a storm

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his scout troop are assigned an almighty task - a beachclean! It soon seems too much, how can they clean ALL the trash?But Caillous imagination saves the day.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Detective Caillou investigates the case of the missing bouncy ball -and everyone in the family is a suspect!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Someone in Busytown Park got rid of Sally and Hildas newly drawn hopscotch board. Huckle and Lowly set about helping the girls find out whos responsible. programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is playing basketball but each time he tries to dunk, the coconut flies off and hits poor Parrot...Mole appears and tells them dolphins are known for their ability to leap high into the air... off they go in search for dolphin in the sea, when they see dolphin dives in they follow. They invite dolphin to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy is looking after James and Sarahs guinea pig, Norris. But when Norris escapes, in the ensuing chaos, Mandy accidentally starts a fire.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The Pioneers work on Annies farm, but Sarah accidentally lets the sheep go loose. They knock over Annies stove which starts a fire.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: While practicing for their school’s upcoming Bike Jamboree, Franklin takes a little spill. Spooked, he goes from avoiding his bike altogether to trying to making it tumble-proof. But it is only after finding himself giving Fox advice to keep at a skateboard trick he’s having trouble with that Franklin realizes what he has to do – get back in the saddle! / Goose isn’t having any fun on Franklin’s new holiday – Backwards Day. programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The children set out to find a treasure that Grandpa and his best friend hid in the forest a long time ago. And the long time is the problem as Grandpa’s clues are no longer very accurate…

programme.title: Doodleboo

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who never has to go to the dentist? Doodleboo explains how to draw a crocodile.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What would we need if we adopted a baby dragon? Doodledoo explains how to draw a Fire Truck.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have some big, tall fun in Hatty’s garden, but who is the tallest? Who is taller than Hatty’s tallest sunflower? Who is the tallest when wearing stilts? And what is the tallest thing they can see? When Tweet says she wants to be the tallest, her friends take her to the top of the tallest mountain - but she gets dizzy and decides she’s happy being the smallest after all.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave take their Rollypods to the Rollypod Garage for a bubble makeover! They fix Dave’s broken car-hooter, pump up their tyres so their Rollypods will go faster and polish up their paintwork until it sparkles. Then it’s time to show off their shiny new vehicles in a friendly Rollypod race!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare befriends a little yellow fluffy creature by the river, and it follows him everywhere, quacking and copying his every move. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare sees Blue Bird building a nest, he thinks it looks like fun, so he and Little Field Mouse build one themselves. programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare teaches Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends to play hide-and-seek, but the boisterous little hare finds it hard to stay still and quiet, especially when the Spring meadow is full of birds, butterflies and lizards to chase. programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: We see Parrot packing a picnic basket, Mole appears and suggests taking a magnifying glass so they can explore nature and all of its small wonders.
